A friendly reminder to please be patient with bus transportation the first few weeks of school. As new bus drivers learn routes, reinforce safety procedures, local traffic increases, and our new student bus riders may be leaving mom and dad for the first time and getting on a bus, there could be delays in the morning and afternoon. Bus drivers take time the first few weeks to learn the names of the students riding the bus and to make sure all students are safe and comfortable. Our transportation department buses an estimated of 6,000 students to 40 different locations in a 2-hour window in the morning and a 2-hour window in the afternoon. We use 55 buses and 10 vans every day to make sure students arrive to school and home safely.

In addition, please be aware of the many walkers and high school student drivers who will be driving on the roads, walking to school on sidewalks, and standing at bus stops throughout Township neighborhoods early in the morning. Student safety is of utmost importance to our district.

A team of six MT students earned second place in the First Lego League (FLL) Pennsylvania East Regional Tournament for Robot Design – Strategy and Innovation Solution! A total of 60 teams participated in the tournament across Eastern Pennsylvania. As part of the FLL competition, students had to research and present a problem related to a city, and then complete a set of various missions related to the project. The team’s research project was “How to solve the parking problem for the Lancaster Train Station”. The students surveyed over 50+ actual train riders and then proposed a solution to eliminate the parking issue at the train station.

Congratulations to Wesley Showalter (4th grade at Reidenbaugh), Austin Ishler (5th grade at Landis Run), Benjamin Doumaux (5th grade at Landis Run), Tirth Parikh (5th grade at Landis Run), Graham Forman (6th grade at Landis Run), and Joshua Henshaw (6th grade at Landis Run). The team was coached by Bhavin Parikh.

Pictured with the trophy, from left to right is: Wesley Showalter, Benjamin Doumaux, Tirth Parikh, and Austin Isler.
#MTProud
